net.fec.openrq.encoder

Interface SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder

  • Enclosing interface:
    SourceBlockEncoder

    public static interface SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder
    A builder class for an Iterable over EncodingPacket instances.

    This class builds iterables over a sequence of encoding packets (whose encoding symbols have contiguous encoding symbol identifiers (ESI)). The resulting iterable can be configured to start or end at a particular ESI

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Iterable<EncodingPacket> build()
      Returns the resulting iterable over encoding packets based on the currently defined properties.
      SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder endAt(int esi)

    • Method Detail

      • startAt

        SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder startAt(int esi)
        Defines the encoding symbol identifier (ESI) of the symbol in the first encoding packet. If a starting ESI is not defined, then the resulting iterable starts at ESI 0.

        Note: If the starting ESI is greater than the ending ESI, then the ending ESI will be set to the starting ESI.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, and max_esi as the maximum value for the encoding symbol identifier, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ 0
        • esi ≤ max_esi
        Parameters:
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the symbol in the first encoding packet
        Returns:
        this builder (for chained invocation)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier is invalid

      • startAtInitialSourceSymbol

        SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder startAtInitialSourceSymbol()
        Convenience method for defining the starting encoding symbol identifier (ESI) to the ESI of the first source symbol.
        Returns:
        this builder (for chained invocation)

      • startAtInitialRepairSymbol

        SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder startAtInitialRepairSymbol()
        Convenience method for defining the starting encoding symbol identifier (ESI) to the ESI of the first repair symbol.
        Returns:
        this builder (for chained invocation)

      • endAt

        SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder endAt(int esi)
        Defines the encoding symbol identifier (ESI) of the symbol in the last encoding packet. If an ending ESI is not defined, then the resulting iterable ends at the maximum value for the ESI.

        Note: If the ending ESI is less than the starting ESI, then the starting ESI will be set to the ending ESI.

        Bounds checking - If we have K as the number of source symbols into which is divided the source block being encoded, and max_esi as the maximum value for the encoding symbol identifier, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • esi ≥ 0
        • esi ≤ max_esi
        Parameters:
        esi - The encoding symbol identifier of the symbol in the last encoding packet
        Returns:
        this builder (for chained invocation)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided encoding symbol identifier is invalid

      • endAtFinalSourceSymbol

        SourceBlockEncoder.IterableBuilder endAtFinalSourceSymbol()
        Convenience method for defining the ending encoding symbol identifier (ESI) to the ESI of the last source symbol.
        Returns:
        this builder (for chained invocation)

      • build

        Iterable<EncodingPacket> build()
        Returns the resulting iterable over encoding packets based on the currently defined properties. Each iterated encoding packet contains a single encoding symbol within.

        Note: The iterator from the resulting iterable will not support the remove() method.

        Returns:
        the resulting iterable over encoding packets
